title: AWS re:Invent 2025 - From Trigger to Execution: The Journey of Events in AWS Lambda (CNS423)
title_cn: AWS re:Invent 2025 - 从触发到执行：AWS Lambda 中的事件之旅 (CNS423)
abstract: Dive deep into AWS Lambda's event processing ecosystem. We'll explore diverse event sources including queuing (SQS), streaming (Kinesis, DynamoDB Streams), and private sources (EventBridge Pipes, Kafka). Uncover Lambda's sophisticated message buffering and synchronous invocation mechanisms. Learn how Lambda ensures high availability through static stability and rapid AZ failover, and manages backpressure to prevent system overload. We'll examine Lambda destinations for advanced event routing and error handling. By mastering these concepts, you'll optimize your serverless architectures for reliability, performance, and scalability. Join us to unlock the full potential of event-driven computing with AWS Lambda, from trigger to execution and beyond.
abstract_cn: 深入探讨 AWS Lambda 的事件处理生态系统。我们将探索多样化的事件源，包括队列（SQS）、流式处理（Kinesis、DynamoDB Streams）以及私有源（EventBridge Pipes、Kafka）。揭示 Lambda 复杂的消息缓冲和同步调用机制。了解 Lambda 如何通过静态稳定性和快速可用区故障转移确保高可用性，以及如何管理背压以防止系统过载。我们将研究 Lambda 目标，用于高级事件路由和错误处理。通过掌握这些概念，您将优化无服务器架构的可靠性、性能和可扩展性。加入我们，释放 AWS Lambda 事件驱动计算的全部潜力，从触发到执行及更多。
